verses.text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, When we remembered Zion.
We hanged our harps Upon the willows in the midst thereof.
For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; And they that wasted us \add required of us\add* mirth, \add Saying\add*, Sing us \add one\add* of the songs of Zion.
How shall we sing the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* song In a strange land?
If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand forget \add her cunning\add*.
If I do not remember thee, Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; If I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
Remember, O \sc Lord\sc*, the children of Edom \add in\add* the day of Jerusalem; Who said, Rase \add it\add*, rase \add it, even\add* to the foundation thereof.
O daughter of Babylon, who art \add to be\add* destroyed; Happy \add shall he be\add*, that rewardeth thee As thou hast served us.
Happy \add shall he be\add* that taketh And dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
